title: How they even got the star??
text: I don’t understand how this restaurant can have a Michelin star, because it’s a joke, not a high class establishment. We came here on our Christmas trip in Vienna, as we were staying at SO Sofitel and opted for the special Christmas menu with wine pairing (the bill came approx 550 eur for two people). Well, these were the most stupidly spent 500 eur! Yes, the view is amazing and the ceiling decor is very impressive, but that’s it for the good things. The food was average, main fish dish was very over salted, other dishes were ok, but nothing close to innovative. The service was chaotic, messed up and left the strong impression that all those young waiters just don’t have a clue what they are doing. Some dishes came rushed, for some we needed to wait too long, they didn’t follow the pattern of our eating speed and just brought out whatever the kitchen gave to them. At the end our waiter literally killed us when he brought us the bill before the dessert and asked us to pay because “he ends his shift”. He then came back after 5 min, standing there and asking for money to be payed immediately. As customers we don’t care for his shifts, the bill should be brought at the end of the meal and this kind of service is not appropriate in any restaurant, not even speaking of a high class one. Speaking of dessert , I guess that for 550 eur the Michelin star restaurant could at least offer a coffee with it. Instead, our waiter informed us that it is not included. He could bring us a coffee to excuse himself for the rushed bill, but I guess it didn’t come to his mind. It is very nice that the restaurant manager so eagerly replies on each comment, but he could instead go “above and beyond” to finally train his staff, otherwise this restaurant is a true shame on Michelin guide, despite all its potential.

title: Absolutely the best ribs in Vienna!
text: We come here almost every time we visit Vienna! Their ribs are really the best in Vienna, you can get both the traditional and flavoured ones. My favourite is Orange ribs with orange and plum sauce, but you can opt for mixed trio and then you can choose three different ribs to try. From the starters fried mozzarella is worth to try. The prices are more than affordable, the service is friendly. Recommended to book, as the place is usually full. Enjoy!

title: Our favourite restaurant in Vienna!
text: Fabios is our favourite restaurant in Vienna! It’s very chic and classy, with wonderful service and amazing food, I think you can’t get wrong here with any choice from the menu. We especially like the beef carpaccio, tuna tartar, eggplant starter and monkfish with prosciutto. They also make good cocktails and have a separate bar area if you want to pass by just for drinks. Book your table in advance, dress up and be ready for a great evening!

title: Yummy grilled fish platter
text: This restaurant was a very pleasant surprise! I wasn’t sure what to expect, based on controversial reviews but as I wanted to go to fish restaurant, we decided to give it a try. And I am glad we did! We took the grilled fish platter, big enough for 4 people (so be careful and don’t over order the starters!) with truffle mashed potatoes and spinach, oysters and tuna starter in some amazing sauce. All the food was superb! The waiter advised us a nice Riesling to pair with the food. The location on the market can be a bit confusing, but the restaurant’s setting is nice and the quality of food is worth the trip here.

title: Best Shoreditch tour with Henri
text: If you want to do an alternative tour in London, make sure you do one of these ones! I chose Shoreditch tour with Henri and it blew my mind away. I love walking tours and do them all around the world, but it’s really rare to see such engaging, knowledgeable, fun and easy going guide as Henri! He has a great understanding of the history of the area and art movement, which emerged here. Despite rain and cold, we had the most pleasant two hours and time flew too fast! Henri is a great guy and he shared also stories about him and his experience as a homeless person and that changed my perspective of the subject quite a lot. I will definitely go on other tours with this company and strongly advise you to do the same! It’s not only participating in a good cause, supporting a social enterprise, but also getting high quality tour because believe me, these guides are brilliant. Thank you Henri for a wonderful time!

title: Really the best on Brick lane!
text: The best experience in this London trip! I came here after a Shoreditch tour on rainy afternoon, literally shaking with cold and very hungry and was greeted by the warmest way possible! I felt like I was visiting friends, not just looking for place to eat and warm up. Oh and speaking about eating - all the food was great! I had papadam and cheese Naan and Chicken masala for the main, which is my favourite dish. Also make sure to try spicy tea - just on spot after walking in the cold. I will definitely be back to try some more food and I strongly advise you to give The Monsoon the try! It’s worth it! :)

title: Night out with friends
text: Very cool and stylish place with nice vibe. We started with the drinks by the bar (by the way, cocktails are seriously good here), following by dinner and then some dancing at the bar area. The place was packed, lots of fun and the food was good as well. I give 4 stars instead of 5 only because of too loud music which made it difficult to communicate during dinner. Otherwise, if you are with friends and want to have a night out, this is a great choice!

title: Nice vibe and great food
text: We loved our evening at Zuma! It has a cool vibe, the place was quite full but not too crowded and the bar area is great for pre dinner drinks. Nice music and not too loud so you can easily speak with your partner. We prefer to sit upstairs as it’s more informal. The food was great as usual, we particularly enjoyed soft shell crab, Chilean sea bass and black cod. Fabulous place for going out with friends or your loved one!

title: Very special and authentic hotel
text: Amazing hotel in the middle of historical district of Sultanahmet! Once you walk inside, you feel like stepping into oriental palace. The hotel’s decoration is truly beautiful, with silk carpets and tapestry, handmade ornate furniture with mother of pearl incrustations, hand painted tiles, marble bathrooms, artworks of Turkish artists. Service was warm and welcoming from the moment we arrived. The hotel offers free shuttle service to major sights, but the location also allows you to walk to Grand Bazaar and Aya Sofia area. Breakfast restaurant offers great views over the marina and is a stunning place for your morning cappuccino. You need to note that no alcohol is served at this hotel and gym and spa has separate visiting times for men and women. But you can book the whole spa area for private use for 2 hours from 22.00 to 24.00 and it’s a wonderful experience which you can share with your loved one. We tried the traditional hammam ritual and it was great! Overall, we really enjoyed our stay here!

title: Oldest shisha place in Istanbul
text: This amazing place near the Grand Bazaar is the oldest shisha place in Istanbul and I would recommend you to visit it if you want to have a different and authenic experience. They make really good shishas with smooth smoke and the guy is carrying around the tray with Turkish teas (apple is my favourite)... They have different rooms in the courtyard, but I think the offer is pretty much the same. Stop by if you are in the area!

title: Beautiful restaurant in Sultanahmet
text: We ate dinner here once while staying at the Ajwa hotel. Didnt't know what to expect, but were very pleasantly surprised at the end! Restaurant is very beautiful and opulent, with magnificent view, so come before the sunset to be able to enjoy it! The service is outstanding - very friendly, but proffessional. And the food is top! Try the Azerbaijani plov - it's really good, nicely served and the portion is big enough to serve 3-4 people. And make sure to find your favourite sherbet from their selection (it will be hard as they all are good). If you want calm, romantic meal in beautiful surroundings, this is a good choice in Sultanahmet district.

title: Stylish place for a evening out
text: Maybe we were just lucky but we had a perfect evening at Zuma! It's a very stylish place with good music and nice ambiance. The food was great, the service was attentive, but not overwhelming. The only negative point was that this location is quite far from the historical part of Istanbul where we were staying, but in such big city as Istanbul you can't expect to have everything in walking distance. If you like Japanese cousine - don't hesitate and book a table at Zuma!

title: Friendly little place with fantastic food
text: This is small, loud and very delicious place in lively Beyoglu neighbourhood. All the mezes were fantastic, we especially liked sea bass ceviche and prawns in curry souce. I guess you can't go wrong with food choice here! The small plates are perfect for sharing, so you can try a lot of different things. Maybe not a place for romantic dinner, but for sure a place worth visiting if you are in Istanbul!

title: Top experience at Mikla
text: Mikla is an amazing restaurant with great view, top class cousine, attentive and proffessional service. We took a combo of 3 dishes for each of us and all the food was very good. I didn't find the price very expensive, given the quality of food. I would recommend Mikla for a date night or special occasion!

title: Magical view of Acropolis
text: First, the view truly is spectacular. If you don't come for dinner, at least stop here for coctails and make some great pictures. The quality of food was fine - not outstanding, but not bad either. As for the service - they tried to make an effort, but something went wrong. :) For this kind of restaurant service must be flawless, which it wasn't.

title: Must see in Athens and actually very enjoyable visit
text: Acropolis is the must see atraction in Athens and it is totally worth it! Maybe I was lucky, but I didn't have any problems with the queues or crowds. I bought my ticket on the site, waited in line maybe 10 min max and then got in without any lines at all. It was crowded up there, but not too dramatic. Of course, things will be very different in season. I also did find the climb up the hill to be very easy for a reasonably fit person. The site itself is very impessive, but I would take a guide if I can suggest, because there is not much of explanations and the ones which are present, are quite limited and cover mostly the architectural part of the monuments, but won't tell you much about the mythology side. As for me, the mythology is equally, if not even more exciting. :) Don't just go straight up the hill and away, walk also around it as there you will see even more interesting sights. And make sure to visit the Acropolis museum - it's a separate ticket, but it will help you to understand, what you see. And it's not a big exibition, so it won't take much of your time. Enjoy!

title: Great tour with Ares
text: I love free walking tours and try to do them in every new place that I visit. Today I had an amazing 3 h tour with Ares and I would like to say that it is a must do in Athens! We covered so many sights and learned much about the history of Athens in non-boring way. :) Try to do this tour at the beginning of your trip, as you will have a better understanding about the layout of Athens, places to eat, to shop, to go out... Thank you Ares for the great tour!

title: Beautiful Belle Epogue Villa
text: This beautiful villa looks like pink jewellery box inside lush green gardens. Gardens are nice to stroll around and provide stunning views of the coast, go on clear sunny day to take a lot of good pictures! The gardens are interestingly laid out and very lush, but they are not too manicured... you can sense a bit of wilderness feeling. Someone commented that gardens are not well looked after, but to me the natural look actually added to the appeal. The villa itself is equally beautiful and filled with antique firniture and small design objects. I can stay for hours in such place, admiring every cup and vase. :) All in all, very charming place, recommended for a visit!

title: Great evening
text: We had a great time in Buddha Bar! We started with coctails downstairs and continued with dinner upstairs. Everything was very good - the drinks, the food, the service, music and ambiance. Thank you Buddha Bar!

title: Must-see if you are in Èze!
text: These gardens are truly amazing, the scenery, the cacti, the sculptures and above all the views! The best views are from here, not from fancy hotels terraces (although such patio makes a good and logical next stop for a glass of wine or coffee). Pick the bright and sunny day so you can make the best photos. For just 6 eur entrance fee this is an absolute must see if you are visiting beautiful Èze!

title: Loved the view, coctails and atmosphere
text: We stopped here for drinks and light lunch after visiting Èze and botanical garden. The view is breathtaking, coctails were very good and the food also was delicious. It's easy to pass all afternoon here!

title: Nice lunch in iconic place
text: We had a very nice lunch here! I loved the Art Deco interior with golden details, very classy. The location is perfect for people watching from the terrace but it was too cold unfortunately to eat outside. Speaking about the food, it was good! We had dover sole and prawns and both enjoyed our meal. The service also was nice or maybe we were just lucky! I have read positive and not so positive reviews about this place and yes, it is too expensive as you pay for the sake of being here... but apart from that I really have nothing to complain about as all was very good!
place: Brasserie du Cafe de Paris Monte-Carlo

title: Amazing restaurant with fantastic food and atmosphere!
text: La Mome was recommended to me by a friend as her favourite restaurant in Cannes and I fully agree with her! The place is wonderful - very romantic setting in quiet side street, plenty of seating inside and outside, live music. Both the food and the service were great, very good menu and wine list... Totally loved this place, would recommend it for a special occassion or romantic dinner!

title: Great quality seafood in Nice
text: I would give 5 stars for the food and 3 stars for the service and ambiance - it sums up to 4 stars in total. The food is great, if you like cold seafood of course. We took the platter with oysters, big prawns, langustines and crab legs, all was good and fresh. The service was quite rushed, but overall ok for such place - it's not a restaurant and they are interested in turning tables quickly. The ambiance is busy and noisy bistro atmosphere. It's definitely not a place for romantic dinner, more like quickly eat and go place. But I would give it a try for the food!

title: Nice restaurant with room for improvement
text: Good quality products, but the seasoning and presentation of the food could be improved. For example, my octopus carpaccio was soaking in olive oil - I don't think that carpaccio should look like a soup. It was delicious, though. Oysters were served just with one piece of lemon - from the seafood restaurant I would expect also some vinegar added. Fries were also served plain, no sauces, not even mayo. The cod and prawns were good. Service need to be improved. We waited a long time to be seated, staff was passing by, not even paying attention to us standing by the door. Actually it is a typical problem for Polish restaurants, as I understood. Once seated, they mixed up our order. Our waiter was really upset and fixed it quickly, so we can't blaim him. But these are the small things, which distinguish a good restaurant from the great one. However, it is still the best place in Sopot for seafood, so give it a try!

title: Yummy food in the heart of Old town
text: The food was great, we had jumbo combo and their special fries. Coctails were very average, so better stick with the beer. Service could be improved, we waited among other people to be seated and passing waiters didn't even look our way. It was impossible to notice that there is a queue at the door. But once we were seated, we got very nice waitress and she really did a great job. Prices are cheap, comparing with similar meal in our country. Overall it was a nice meal, but there still is a room to improve!

title: The best WWII museum so far
text: This is the absolute must see when visiting Gdansk and so far it's the best WWII museum that I have visited. It's huge, you'll need good 4 hours here, but for us it wasn't tiring and time flew so fast. You can buy ticket online (recommended to go in at 14.00 as the latest so you have 4 h till closing time) and take the audioguide at the museum. Exibition shows WWII with emphasis on Poland and Eastern front, but it's not limited only to that. It consists of actual war time artefacts and also lots of audiovisual material, which makes learning easier. I would definitely take here children, who learn about WWII in school. One visit here can seriously improve their understanding about the subject. And I would also recommend every adult to visit the museum. Regardless if you like history or not, this is one thing that we all should know and remember...
place: Museum of the Second World War (Muzeum II Wojny Swiatowej)

title: Engaging and informative tour
text: We had an excellent Old town tour with Kate (Dynamite). She was a great guide, with perfect English, nice voice, which you could hear even from the back of the group and good knowledge of city's ancient and modern day history. It started to rain at the second part of our tour, but we didn't care, because the tour was so interesting! Free walking tours are really the best way how to explore the city! Only please remember that is is not "free" - your donation is guide's salary, from which they also pay taxes plus commission to the company. So please respect their job and don't donate just a couple of euros!

title: Cool boat tour
text: Great boat tour with nice, chilled vibe. We were lucky with the rest of the group, so were joking and laughing all the time. Loved the small size of the group and possibility to chat with captain and other passengers. At the end of the tour our group even went for dinner together, which was an amazing ending of evening, thanks TDBG for that! You can bring your own drinks to the boat (which is cool) and it's allowed to smoke. It's not a problem for non-smokers, as smoking seats are in the back (I personally didn't smell anything). We loved to see the part of A-dam, where big boats don't visit, as well as most beautiful main canals. The only thing which could be better - our captain was super friendly and he answered our questions, but he didn't give us much info about the city by his own initiative. We were not expecting a traditional tour, but would love to hear more informal info, tips and curious facts about the city. Our tour was more like a friends party on the boat, which is also a good thing, but maybe not for everyone's liking.

title: Unforgettable day in tulip fields
text: Renting a bike is a must when visiting bulb region, as there isn't a better way how to explore flower fields than on a bike! This is the only bike rental just outside Keukenhof (in the parking lot), so you can combine a ride with visiting the gardens. In this location bike hire for one day is 15 eur and you can prebook your bike online. We were given a map with possible cycling routes, but at the end we didn't follow them. We cycled to the beach and then turned to Noordwijk and Sassenheim, where we found very Instagrammable tulip fields! I would highly recommend this activity to everyone!

title: Cool local spot for a drink
text: Mixed feelings. On the one hand, it is very cool local spot with nice vibe, friendly staff and good beer selection. On the other hand, the food unfortunately did not deliver. On the night when we visited they didn't have half of the menu, so we ended up with steak, meatballs in tomato souce and nachos. Nachos were very good, other dishes were average. Maybe we just visited on the wrong night! Anyway, it is a nice place for a drink and spending time with friends!

title: Flower power
text: I was afraid that I won't enjoy Keukenhof given how much it's crowded, but I loved it nevertheless! It's easy to get here woth the bus from Amsterdam airport, the combi ticket for the bus and gardens could be bought on same spot. Yes, there was a queue for the bus, but it moved very quickly. The garden itself is very beautiful and even the crowds couldn't spoil the experience. Just be prepared that it won't be a relaxing stroll. The garden is not that big and I don't think it's needed to stay all day in Keukenhof, you can better rent bicycles outside the park entrance and ride to the tulip fields. Overall, it was a nice and unique experience!

title: Late night dinner on canal
text: We were recommended to come to this restaurant by the guide on our boat trip, he shared some local knowledge. :) Well, it may be not the best pizza in my life, but still on top of the list. Here pizza is made from good quality ingredients and comes from real wood oven, which makes it taste so good! We took our pizzas from take away restaurant and ate them sitting on canal, so I can't comment about the other restaurant opposite the street. In take away part there were also a few tables, but in my opinion the place wasn't very cosy for eating in and it lacked any Italian atmosphere inside.

title: Small, cosy spot for a quick bite
text: We never tried Nepalese food before, so were keen to come here. As usual, there were a queue outside, but it moved fast and we got a table in 20 min time. The place is small and cosy but definitely not suited for slow, romantic dinner! The service is fast and efficient, I loved that the waiter explained the food on the menu and helped us to make a choice. The food itself was delicious, I particulary liked the dumplings. If you want to try Nepalese food, here is a good place to do it!

title: Lovely small museum
text: It is one of the canal houses which are opened to public. Here you can see how the wealthy merchant family lived. The interiors are very cute and there are also explanations about each room. We loved our visit and found the museum very interesting. It's not big, so you can be done in one hour, but it's worth it!

title: Streetfood madness
text: I love foodhalls, so I was eager to visit this one. One of the reasons to visit it on that particular day were long working hours, stated in this listing. The hall is pretty nice and has big variety of food, but unfortunately we didn't had an oportunity to try it all. Although it states to be opened till 1 AM on Fri, Sat, lots of food stalls were already closed or closing down at 22.00 when we arrived. Apparently only the bar stays open so late. So our choice of food was quite limited and I couldn't try the things I wanted. I would visit again, but in different time.

title: Ride like a local
text: Great bike rental service! Big amount of different type bikes, they come with chain and key, so easy to park. Service was good and we could book our bikes on their webpage and pick them up at our selected location. Bikes can be returned to any of their service points and also repair service is available, if needed. We really enjoyed this experience and could explore the further parts of Amsterdam, which would be hard to do on foot.

title: Did you know that you can eat your breakfast without Instagramming it?
text: Actually this quote is written on their napkin holders and it is so true because it's one of the most Instagrammable cafes in Amsterdam! The food presentation will make you want to grab your camera. And it tastes as good as it looks! The whole place is very cute and cosy. I would advise you to book a table (via their webpage) and to bring your card because they don't take cash. It was not cheap, but I would go back in a heartbeat!

title: Cute breakfast spot
text: Cute, popular breakfast place. It was full when we visited, so had to wait around 10 min to be seated, which is ok. Unfortunately then we waited another 40 min for our food to arrive. We were not in a hurry, but apparently it's not a place for a quick bite. When the food arrived, it was fine, coffee was also good. Overall, I would visit again if I stayed nearby, but I wouldn't go out of my way just to eat here.

title: A must do for all art lovers
text: I loved this museum! Van Gogh is one of my favourite painters and seeing so many of his works in one place was a real treat. Don't miss taking the audioguide, it's excellent and provides a deeper understanding about Van Gogh's life and work. I would say that you should plan 2 hours for the museum itself and then some more time for the Hockney exibition. Tickets can be bought online for spwcific time slot. We visited Amsterdam at Easter holidays and booked tickets 2 weeks ahead, and there were only a couple of time slots left, so better buy the tickets well in advance.

title: Great tour with Ricardo
text: I love free walking tours and find them to have much more value than regular tours. This time we had a walk with Ricardo and really enjoyed the tour. I think it was one of the best we ever had! Ricardo is fantastic guide, very fun and knowledgeable, with passion for what he does. We learned a lot about the city and it gave our trip a whole new meaning. It's always a lot more fun if you know and understand the country which you are visiting. We loved that Ricardo explained us not only the historical facts, but also the culture and spirit of Amsterdam and Netherlands, including the "would like to know, but too shy to ask" questions about Red lights and (not so) legal weed. Thank you, Ricardo!

title: Great choice for seafood lovers
text: I have heard about The Seafood bar long before we booked our trip to Amsterdam, so I was eager to give it a try. Reservation can be easily made by webpage, you can also get a table without it, but be prepared to wait. The food was fantastic, we shared the oysters and mixed cold and hot seafood plateau, so it was plenty of choice. All was fresh and delicious! They have good French cremant, which is perfect, if you want some bubbles with your oysters. Service is professional and friendly and restaurant was full when we visited. Yes, maybe not a place for romantic candellight dinner, but that's why it's called a bar! All is good here and I would strongly recomend this restaurant for all seafood lovers!

title: Perfect addition to Riga's dining scene
text: Riga has deserved it for a long time and finally it's here - the foodcourt in Central market is opened! Riga's central market is one of the biggest and oldest in Europe. And yes, the foodcourt perfectly fits in central market scene - the same you can see in Barcelona, Lisbon, Berlin, Amsterdam and now also in Riga! Food is very good, here you will find everything, starting from traditional street food to seafood, sushi, grill, yummy bowls, vegetarian options, crepes and waffles. In center is a big bar which also makes delicious coctails if you want something more than just a beer. The atmosphere is vibrant and cheerful and the service was very friendly. I will definitely come back and I can highly recommend Centralais food court to all residents and visitors of Riga!

title: Amazing day with Etna 3000 trip
text: We had a amazing day on Etna with Fabrizio! Going up the vulcano with the guide is completely different experience than doing it alone. We were shown and told so many things about the vulcano and Sicily, it gave us a much deeper understanding and excitement about what we saw. We went up to 3000 m, saw different craters, went into the lava tube, had the chance to run on vulcanic sand. Delicious home made lunch was a very nice touch! Fabrizio was a great guide and we enjoyed every minute of the trip. Highly recommend!

title: The right choice for perfect dinner
text: We had a lovely dinner at Caviar & Bull. We booked the table on terrace and had a nice view over the bay. The food was delicious, we had Contemprorary tasting menu, which had a nice balance between fish and meat dishes. Beef carpaccio was particulary good! Service is swift and professional, thumbs up for all staff! Prices are very reasonable for the quality that you get. We left the restaurant very satisfied!

title: Every corner is picture-perfectq
text: A maze of romantic narrow streets, full of local character and charm. A real delight to stroll around in day or evening. I wanted to take picture of every single street, every corner! Lots of restaurants and bars for dinner or drinks, lots of shopping options. Nearby is private lido and a wooden platform where you can take a swim or just see the sunset from the rocks. In my opinion, Ortigia is the best place where to stay in Syracuse!

title: Coctails in romantic countryard
text: Lovely place for evening drinks in Ortigia! First, the setting is very romantic - in a beautiful countyard, tables are lit with candles, the ambience is stylish and relaxed. Coctails are of best quality, creative and unusual, lots of them were invented by the barmen. About the taste I will say honestly - some we liked more, some less. But it's a subject of individual taste. Service is nice and attentive, but a bit slow. Overall, if you want something different from traditional Aperol Spritz, come here!

title: Fresh fish and seafood
text: Perfect place for fish and seafood lovers! We shared selection of different dishes - fried fish mix, caponata, octopus salad, potatos, calamari, all was cooked to perfection! They serve also fresh caught of the day, cooked to your liking. Just ask, what fish do they have! Also very delicious cannoli, which are made in house. The bill for two was 45 eur, good value for money.

title: Relaxing day by the pool
text:
We spent a nice day by the pool at Cafe del Mar. In my opinion, the best sunbeds are Vip beds by the pool, yes, it's pricey, but if your budget allows, go for it. 20 € sunbeds are uncomfortable and placed by the small pool (good only if your are with kids) and 25 € beds are better but still quite small and all squeezed together. You can rent towels for 5 €, ask the staff. Convenient shower facilities. The pool is fantastic, only I wish it was deeper (it's 1.25 with deeper water at one end). Service was professional and attentive, coctails were very good. Music could be little more quiet. For lunch we took the sushi which were ok and pizza with seefood which was much better than I expected!
I really enjoyed the day at Cafe del Mar and would return on my next visit to Malta!

title: Day on the water
text: We booked a self drive boat for 4h, it was not expensive and we had a great time! Boat was clean and in excellent technical condition, the staff gave us explicit instructions how to drive it and how to use navigation, which places to avoid (reefs, shallow waters), very professional service! Renting a self drive boat is a good way to explore Gozo and Comino and the famous Blue Lagoon!

title: Place with local character
text: The best place for pastizzi - traditional Maltese pastry. We tried them with chicken and cheese filling, both equally good. Don't expect white tableclothes or table service, do expect lots of locals sitting here with their pastries and glass of tea with milk. As we love such places with strong local character, I give it a solid 5 stars!

title: Stunning interior
text: The most lavishly decorated church I have ever seen! The knights didn't save money on it's decoration - each wall sparkles in gold. Entrance ticket comes with excellent audioguide in different languages. In oratory there's a beautiful painting by Caravaggio. Must visit if you are in Valletta!

title: Fantastic place for a swim
text: This is a highlight of our trip to Malta! Natural pool with crystal clear waters and dramatic scenary. Around 20-30 min walk from Marsaxlokk and then some min down a rocky path to the beach. On the top there is a car park and little place selling snacks and drinks. You can jump off the rocks or use the ladder. It's fantastic place for a swim!

title: Perfectly cooked rabbit
text: This small, unpretendious restaurant serves great traditional food! Trip Adviser states that it opens only for dinner, which is not true, you can go also for lunch. Restaurant has a couple of tables inside and couple on small terrace, so it's better to book. We had fried octopus and snails for starter and rabbit in wine gravy for mains. Everything was cooked to perfection! Local red wine went good with the rabbit. Service was friendly, we didn't have to wait long for our food. If you like meat and want to have a traditional meal in Malta, this is a good choice!

title: Warm welcome and delicious meal
text: We had a lovely dinner at Ta' Victor! We were lucky to get a table in last minute, but I would suggest to book ahead because several visitors were declined because they had no reservation. On arrival we were greeted by Victor, the owner. The dinner is in form of set menu, where you get a maltese platter for starter, traditional fish broth, a choice of fish or meat for mains and a dessert, which was yummy ice cream with cinnanon pastry. The food was divine! We had red snapper for mains, but I saw that the table next to us ordered steaks and they looked very good as well. All fish is fresh and locally caught, what comes from the sea in morning, gets served in the evening. All in all, we had very pleasant night and felt very welcomed. Thank you, Victor!

title: The best restaurant in Liepaja
text: We have eaten in many places all over the world and what can I say - this place is superb! Go here if you know how to appreciate good food. Stylish atmosphere, attentive service, nice wine selection and very reasonable prices for this quality. Would definately return!

title: Cozy bar with great wine selection
text: We went here to buy some wine to bring home, but returned later for the wine tasting. Very cozy little place with polite and nice staff. Wine was superb! Snack platter was included in price. I have found my new fav red! They also deliver worldwide, so luggage restrictions won't stop you from buying some bottles.

title: Lunch with a view
text: Stopped here for lunch, the view is to die for and our pizzas were very good. Fast and friendly service, reasonable prices. A perfect place in beautiful Varenna!

title: Nice place for lunch
text: We went here for lunch and as they were full, waited some 30 min by the bar, drinking Aperols (really good, by the way). I had pizza Bolongese, which was very delicious and reasonably priced. Fast and efficient service, wonderful setting in narrow cobblestone street. We were passing by later in the evening, there were hanging colorful stringlights and all atmosphere seemed very inviting. Really, I have nothing bad to say about this place. It's not a fine dining, but it definately has its charm and we would eat here again.
